statement: If economic globalisation is inevitable, it should primarily serve the interests of trans-national corporations rather than humanity.
I'd support my country only when it's right.
While no one chooses their country of birth, it's reasonable to feel pride in it.
Our race does not possess inherent superiority compared to others.
The enemy of my enemy is not my friend.
Military action that defies international law cannot be justified.
There is now a reassuring integration of information and entertainment.
People are ultimately divided more by nationality than by class.
Controlling unemployment is more important than controlling inflation.
Since corporations can be trusted to voluntarily protect the environment, regulation is unnecessary.
"From each according to his ability, to each according to his need" is a fundamentally flawed idea.
The freer the market, the less free the people.
"It's a positive reflection on our society that something as basic as drinking water is now a bottled, branded consumer product."
Land should be a commodity to be bought and sold.
It is satisfying that many personal fortunes are made by people who simply manipulate money and contribute nothing to their society.
Protectionism is rarely necessary in trade.
A company's social responsibility shouldn't be limited to delivering profits to its shareholders.
The rich are not taxed enough.
Those who can pay shouldn't have access to better medical care.
Governments should not penalise businesses that mislead the public.
A genuine free market does not require restrictions on the ability of predator multinationals to create monopolies.
Abortion, when the woman's life is not threatened, should not always be illegal.
Not all authority should be questioned.
An eye not for an eye and a tooth not for a tooth.
Taxpayers should be expected to prop up theatres or museums that cannot survive on a commercial basis.
Schools should make classroom attendance compulsory.
All people have their rights, but it's better for all of us if different sorts of people don't keep to their own kind.
Good parents don't resort to spanking their children, even when it's challenging.
It's unnatural for children to keep some secrets from their parents.
Possessing marijuana for personal use should be a criminal offence.
The prime function of schooling should not be to equip the future generation to find jobs.
People with serious inheritable disabilities should have the right to have children.
The most important thing for children to learn isn't to accept discipline.
There are savage and civilised peoples; it's not just about different cultures.
Those who are able to work and refuse the opportunity should expect society's support.
When you are troubled, it's better to think about it, but not to keep busy with more cheerful things.
First-generation immigrants can integrate fully into their new country.
What's good for the most successful corporations isn't necessarily good for everyone.
Some broadcasting institutions, even if their content is independent, should receive public funding.
Our civil liberties are not being excessively curbed in the name of counter-terrorism.
A notable disadvantage of a one-party state is that it doesn't prevent the arguments that can hinder progress, much like in a democratic political system.
Although the electronic age makes official surveillance easier, even innocent people should be worried.
The death penalty should not be considered for the most serious crimes.
In a civilised society, it's not necessary to have people above to obey and below to command.
Abstract art that doesn't represent anything should be considered art.
In criminal justice, rehabilitation should be more important than punishment.
It is worth the effort to try to rehabilitate some criminals.
The businessperson and the manufacturer are not as important as the writer and the artist.
Mothers may have careers, but their first duty is not to be homemakers.
Multinational companies are not exploiting the plant genetic resources of developing countries in an unethical manner.
Making peace with the establishment is not an important aspect of maturity.
Astrology doesn't accurately explain many things.
You can be moral without being religious.
Charity is not better than social security as a means of helping the genuinely disadvantaged.
No one is naturally unlucky.
It is unnecessary for my child's school to instill religious values.
Sex outside marriage is not typically seen as morally wrong.
A same-sex couple in a stable, loving relationship should be excluded from the possibility of child adoption.
Pornography, depicting consenting adults, should not be legal for the adult population.
What goes on in a private bedroom between consenting adults is the business of the state.
"Some people can feel naturally homosexual."
These days, openness about sex hasn't gone far enough.
